1.text: Heat 2 cups (473 ml) water in a microwave or a pot, bringing it to a boil.

2.text: Stir in the 4 cups (946 g) of sugar in 1/2 cup (118 g) increments.

3.text: Remove the solution from the heat and allow it to cool for 15-20 minutes.

4.text: Add food coloring and/or flavoring if you don't want plain rock candy.

5.text: Pour the solution into a large glass or jar where you plan to grow your rock candy crystals.

6.text: Tie one end of a string around the middle of a pencil and tie a weight (such as a paperclip) to the other end.

7.text: Dip the string in the glass of sugar/water solution, remove it, and lay on a piece of wax paper to dry.

8.text: Lower the string into the glass of sugar/water solution, resting the pencil on the top of the glass.

9.text: Place the glass somewhere safe, where it will remain undisturbed.

10.text: Wait one week for crystals to form.

11.text: Carefully remove the string from the solution and lay it on wax paper to dry.

12.text: Wet a skewer or popsicle stick with water and roll it in granulated sugar.

13.text: Hold the skewer in the middle of the glass so that it is not touching the sides and the tip does not touch the bottom of the glass.

14.text: Pinch the dry end of the skewer with the clothespin and rest the clothespin across the top of the glass.

15.text: Place the glass somewhere safe, where it will remain undisturbed.

16.text: Wait one to two weeks for your rock candy to be ready.
